comments.body:
Do you need constructor that mentions that it needs to be created with one single parameter?
https://github.com/sindresorhus/p-lazy/blob/master/index.js#L4

Isn't it inherited from the Promise constructor? When I try it out in the tests, it is being correctly detected when the constructor parameter is missing. Furthermore,  the resolve() and reject() callbacks passed as parameters to the executor fn are also correctly typed in the test.
Sorry I got confused for a second there with Promise constructor taking two parameters instead of a callback with two optional parameters.
Yeah, I know. I hate reading this kind of typings myself. Anyway, thank you for your review!
